enum.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT
enum.description: Micro air vehicle / autopilot classes. This identifies the individual model.

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_GENERIC
entry.description: Generic autopilot, full support for everything

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_GENERIC_WAYPOINTS_ONLY
entry.description: Generic autopilot only supporting simple waypoints

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_GENERIC_WAYPOINTS_AND_SIMPLE_NAVIGATION_ONLY
entry.description: Generic autopilot supporting waypoints and other simple navigation commands

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_GENERIC_MISSION_FULL
entry.description: Generic autopilot supporting the full mission command set

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_INVALID
entry.description: No valid autopilot, e.g. a GCS or other MAVLink component

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_GCS
entry.description: Operator control unit / ground control station

enum.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG
enum.description: These flags encode the MAV mode.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_SAFETY_ARMED
entry.description: 0b10000000 MAV safety set to armed. Motors are enabled / running / can start. Ready to fly.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_HIL_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00100000 hardware in the loop simulation. All motors / actuators are blocked, but internal software is full operational.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_STABILIZE_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00010000 system stabilizes electronically its attitude (and optionally position). It needs however further control inputs to move around.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_GUIDED_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00001000 guided mode enabled, system flies MISSIONs / mission items.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_AUTO_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00000100 autonomous mode enabled, system finds its own goal positions. Guided flag can be set or not, depends on the actual implementation.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_TEST_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00000010 system has a test mode enabled. This flag is intended for temporary system tests and should not be used for stable implementations.

enum.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION
enum.description: These values encode the bit positions of the decode position. These values can be used to read the value of a flag bit by combining the base_mode variable with AND with the flag position value. The result will be either 0 or 1, depending on if the flag is set or not.

enum.name: MAV_GOTO
enum.description: Override command, pauses current mission execution and moves immediately to a position

entry.name: MAV_GOTO_DO_CONTINUE
entry.description: Continue with the next item in mission execution.

entry.name: MAV_GOTO_HOLD_AT_CURRENT_POSITION
entry.description: Hold at the current position of the system

entry.name: MAV_GOTO_HOLD_AT_SPECIFIED_POSITION
entry.description: Hold at the position specified in the parameters of the DO_HOLD action

enum.name: MAV_MODE
enum.description: These defines are predefined OR-combined mode flags. There is no need to use values from this enum, but it simplifies the use of the mode flags. Note that manual input is enabled in all modes as a safety override.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_PREFLIGHT
entry.description: System is not ready to fly, booting, calibrating, etc. No flag is set.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_STABILIZE_DISARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under assisted RC control.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_STABILIZE_ARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under assisted RC control.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_MANUAL_DISARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under manual (RC) control, no stabilization

entry.name: MAV_MODE_MANUAL_ARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under manual (RC) control, no stabilization

entry.name: MAV_MODE_GUIDED_DISARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under autonomous control, manual setpoint

entry.name: MAV_MODE_GUIDED_ARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under autonomous control, manual setpoint

entry.name: MAV_MODE_AUTO_DISARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under autonomous control and navigation (the trajectory is decided onboard and not pre-programmed by MISSIONs)

entry.name: MAV_MODE_AUTO_ARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under autonomous control and navigation (the trajectory is decided onboard and not pre-programmed by MISSIONs)

entry.name: MAV_MODE_TEST_DISARMED
entry.description: UNDEFINED mode. This solely depends on the autopilot - use with caution, intended for developers only.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_TEST_ARMED
entry.description: UNDEFINED mode. This solely depends on the autopilot - use with caution, intended for developers only.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_CALIBRATING
entry.description: System is calibrating and not flight-ready.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_STANDBY
entry.description: System is grounded and on standby. It can be launched any time.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_ACTIVE
entry.description: System is active and might be already airborne. Motors are engaged.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_CRITICAL
entry.description: System is in a non-normal flight mode. It can however still navigate.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_EMERGENCY
entry.description: System is in a non-normal flight mode. It lost control over parts or over the whole airframe. It is in mayday and going down.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_POWEROFF
entry.description: System just initialized its power-down sequence, will shut down now.

enum.name: MAV_SYS_STATUS_SENSOR
enum.description: These encode the sensors whose status is sent as part of the SYS_STATUS message.

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL
entry.description: Global coordinate frame, WGS84 coordinate system. First value / x: latitude, second value / y: longitude, third value / z: positive altitude over mean sea level (MSL)

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_NED
entry.description: Local coordinate frame, Z-up (x: north, y: east, z: down).

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_MISSION
entry.description: NOT a coordinate frame, indicates a mission command.

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL_RELATIVE_ALT
entry.description: Global coordinate frame, WGS84 coordinate system, relative altitude over ground with respect to the home position. First value / x: latitude, second value / y: longitude, third value / z: positive altitude with 0 being at the altitude of the home location.

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_ENU
entry.description: Local coordinate frame, Z-down (x: east, y: north, z: up)

enum.name: MAV_CMD
enum.description: Commands to be executed by the MAV. They can be executed on user request, or as part of a mission script. If the action is used in a mission, the parameter mapping to the waypoint/mission message is as follows: Param 1, Param 2, Param 3, Param 4, X: Param 5, Y:Param 6, Z:Param 7. This command list is similar what ARINC 424 is for commercial aircraft: A data format how to interpret waypoint/mission data.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_WAYPOINT
entry.param: Hold time in decimal seconds. (ignored by fixed wing, time to stay at MISSION for rotary wing)
Acceptance radius in meters (if the sphere with this radius is hit, the MISSION counts as reached)
0 to pass through the WP, if > 0 radius in meters to pass by WP. Positive value for clockwise orbit, negative value for counter-clockwise orbit. Allows trajectory control.
Desired yaw angle at MISSION (rotary wing)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_UNLIM
entry.description: Loiter around this MISSION an unlimited amount of time
entry.param: Radius around MISSION, in meters. If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_TURNS
entry.description: Loiter around this MISSION for X turns
entry.param: Radius around MISSION, in meters. If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_TIME
entry.description: Loiter around this MISSION for X seconds
entry.param: Radius around MISSION, in meters. If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_TAKEOFF
entry.param: Minimum pitch (if airspeed sensor present), desired pitch without sensor
Yaw angle (if magnetometer present), ignored without magnetometer

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_ROI
entry.description: Sets the region of interest (ROI) for a sensor set or the vehicle itself. This can then be used by the vehicles control system to control the vehicle attitude and the attitude of various sensors such as cameras.
entry.param: Region of intereset mode. (see MAV_ROI enum)
MISSION index/ target ID. (see MAV_ROI enum)
ROI index (allows a vehicle to manage multiple ROI's)
x the location of the fixed ROI (see MAV_FRAME)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_PATHPLANNING
entry.description: Control autonomous path planning on the MAV.
entry.param: 0: Disable local obstacle avoidance / local path planning (without resetting map), 1: Enable local path planning, 2: Enable and reset local path planning
0: Disable full path planning (without resetting map), 1: Enable, 2: Enable and reset map/occupancy grid, 3: Enable and reset planned route, but not occupancy grid
Yaw angle at goal, in compass degrees, [0..360]

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LAST
entry.description: NOP - This command is only used to mark the upper limit of the NAV/ACTION commands in the enumeration

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_CHANGE_ALT
entry.description: Ascend/descend at rate. Delay mission state machine until desired altitude reached.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_DISTANCE
entry.description: Delay mission state machine until within desired distance of next NAV point.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_YAW
entry.param: speed during yaw change:[deg per second]
direction: negative: counter clockwise, positive: clockwise [-1,1]

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_LAST
entry.description: NOP - This command is only used to mark the upper limit of the CONDITION commands in the enumeration

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_MODE
entry.param: Mode, as defined by ENUM MAV_MODE

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_JUMP
entry.description: Jump to the desired command in the mission list. Repeat this action only the specified number of times

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_CHANGE_SPEED
entry.description: Change speed and/or throttle set points.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_HOME
entry.description: Changes the home location either to the current location or a specified location.
entry.param: Use current (1=use current location, 0=use specified location)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER
entry.description: Set a system parameter. Caution! Use of this command requires knowledge of the numeric enumeration value of the parameter.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_RELAY
entry.description: Set a relay to a condition.
entry.param: Setting (1=on, 0=off, others possible depending on system hardware)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_REPEAT_RELAY
entry.description: Cycle a relay on and off for a desired number of cyles with a desired period.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_SERVO
entry.description: Set a servo to a desired PWM value.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_REPEAT_SERVO
entry.description: Cycle a between its nominal setting and a desired PWM for a desired number of cycles with a desired period.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_CONTROL_VIDEO
entry.param: Transmission: 0: disabled, 1: enabled compressed, 2: enabled raw
Transmission mode: 0: video stream, >0: single images every n seconds (decimal)
Recording: 0: disabled, 1: enabled compressed, 2: enabled raw

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI
entry.description: Sets the region of interest (ROI) for a sensor set or the vehicle itself. This can then be used by the vehicles control system to control the vehicle attitude and the attitude of various sensors such as cameras.
entry.param: Region of intereset mode. (see MAV_ROI enum)
MISSION index/ target ID. (see MAV_ROI enum)
ROI index (allows a vehicle to manage multiple ROI's)
x the location of the fixed ROI (see MAV_FRAME)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_LAST
entry.description: NOP - This command is only used to mark the upper limit of the DO commands in the enumeration

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_CALIBRATION
entry.description: Trigger calibration. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_SET_SENSOR_OFFSETS
entry.description: Set sensor offsets. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode.
entry.param: Sensor to adjust the offsets for: 0: gyros, 1: accelerometer, 2: magnetometer, 3: barometer, 4: optical flow
X axis offset (or generic dimension 1), in the sensor's raw units
Y axis offset (or generic dimension 2), in the sensor's raw units
Z axis offset (or generic dimension 3), in the sensor's raw units
Generic dimension 4, in the sensor's raw units
Generic dimension 5, in the sensor's raw units
Generic dimension 6, in the sensor's raw units

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_STORAGE
entry.description: Request storage of different parameter values and logs. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode.
entry.param: Parameter storage: 0: READ FROM FLASH/EEPROM, 1: WRITE CURRENT TO FLASH/EEPROM
Mission storage: 0: READ FROM FLASH/EEPROM, 1: WRITE CURRENT TO FLASH/EEPROM

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_REBOOT_SHUTDOWN
entry.description: Request the reboot or shutdown of system components.
entry.param: 0: Do nothing for autopilot, 1: Reboot autopilot, 2: Shutdown autopilot.
0: Do nothing for onboard computer, 1: Reboot onboard computer, 2: Shutdown onboard computer.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_OVERRIDE_GOTO
entry.param: MAV_GOTO_DO_HOLD: hold MAV_GOTO_DO_CONTINUE: continue with next item in mission plan
MAV_GOTO_HOLD_AT_CURRENT_POSITION: Hold at current position MAV_GOTO_HOLD_AT_SPECIFIED_POSITION: hold at specified position
MAV_FRAME coordinate frame of hold point

entry.name: MAV_CMD_MISSION_START
entry.param: first_item: the first mission item to run
last_item: the last mission item to run (after this item is run, the mission ends)

enum.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM
enum.description: Data stream IDs. A data stream is not a fixed set of messages, but rather a recommendation to the autopilot software. Individual autopilots may or may not obey the recommended messages.

enum.name: MAV_ROI
enum.description: The ROI (region of interest) for the vehicle. This can be be used by the vehicle for camera/vehicle attitude alignment (see MAV_CMD_NAV_ROI).

enum.name: MAV_CMD_ACK
enum.description: ACK / NACK / ERROR values as a result of MAV_CMDs and for mission item transmission.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_FAIL
entry.description: Generic error message if none of the other reasons fails or if no detailed error reporting is implemented.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_ACCESS_DENIED
entry.description: The system is refusing to accept this command from this source / communication partner.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_NOT_SUPPORTED
entry.description: Command or mission item is not supported, other commands would be accepted.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_COORDINATE_FRAME_NOT_SUPPORTED
entry.description: The coordinate frame of this command / mission item is not supported.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_COORDINATES_OUT_OF_RANGE
entry.description: The coordinate frame of this command is ok, but he coordinate values exceed the safety limits of this system. This is a generic error, please use the more specific error messages below if possible.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_X_LAT_OUT_OF_RANGE
entry.description: The X or latitude value is out of range.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_Y_LON_OUT_OF_RANGE
entry.description: The Y or longitude value is out of range.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_Z_ALT_OUT_OF_RANGE
entry.description: The Z or altitude value is out of range.

enum.name: MAV_PARAM_TYPE
enum.description: Specifies the datatype of a MAVLink parameter.

enum.name: MAV_MISSION_RESULT
enum.description: result in a mavlink mission ack

entry.name: MAV_MISSION_ERROR
entry.description: generic error / not accepting mission commands at all right now

entry.name: MAV_MISSION_INVALID
entry.description: one of the parameters has an invalid value

entry.name: MAV_MISSION_DENIED
entry.description: not accepting any mission commands from this communication partner

enum.name: MAV_SEVERITY
enum.description: Indicates the severity level, generally used for status messages to indicate their relative urgency. Based on RFC-5424 using expanded definitions at: http://www.kiwisyslog.com/kb/info:-syslog-message-levels/.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_EMERGENCY
entry.description: System is unusable. This is a "panic" condition.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_ALERT
entry.description: Action should be taken immediately. Indicates error in non-critical systems.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_CRITICAL
entry.description: Action must be taken immediately. Indicates failure in a primary system.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_ERROR
entry.description: Indicates an error in secondary/redundant systems.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_WARNING
entry.description: Indicates about a possible future error if this is not resolved within a given timeframe. Example would be a low battery warning.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_NOTICE
entry.description: An unusual event has occured, though not an error condition. This should be investigated for the root cause.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_INFO
entry.description: Normal operational messages. Useful for logging. No action is required for these messages.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_DEBUG
entry.description: Useful non-operational messages that can assist in debugging. These should not occur during normal operation.

message.name: HEARTBEAT
message.description: The heartbeat message shows that a system is present and responding. The type of the MAV and Autopilot hardware allow the receiving system to treat further messages from this system appropriate (e.g. by laying out the user interface based on the autopilot).
message.field: Type of the MAV (quadrotor, helicopter, etc., up to 15 types, defined in MAV_TYPE ENUM)
Autopilot type / class. defined in MAV_AUTOPILOT ENUM
System mode bitfield, see MAV_MODE_FLAGS ENUM in mavlink/include/mavlink_types.h
A bitfield for use for autopilot-specific flags.
System status flag, see MAV_STATE ENUM
MAVLink version, not writable by user, gets added by protocol because of magic data type: uint8_t_mavlink_version

message.name: SYS_STATUS
message.description: The general system state. If the system is following the MAVLink standard, the system state is mainly defined by three orthogonal states/modes: The system mode, which is either LOCKED (motors shut down and locked), MANUAL (system under RC control), GUIDED (system with autonomous position control, position setpoint controlled manually) or AUTO (system guided by path/waypoint planner). The NAV_MODE defined the current flight state: LIFTOFF (often an open-loop maneuver), LANDING, WAYPOINTS or VECTOR. This represents the internal navigation state machine. The system status shows wether the system is currently active or not and if an emergency occured. During the CRITICAL and EMERGENCY states the MAV is still considered to be active, but should start emergency procedures autonomously. After a failure occured it should first move from active to critical to allow manual intervention and then move to emergency after a certain timeout.
message.field: Bitmask showing which onboard controllers and sensors are present. Value of 0: not present. Value of 1: present. Indices defined by ENUM MAV_SYS_STATUS_SENSOR
Bitmask showing which onboard controllers and sensors are enabled: Value of 0: not enabled. Value of 1: enabled. Indices defined by ENUM MAV_SYS_STATUS_SENSOR
Bitmask showing which onboard controllers and sensors are operational or have an error: Value of 0: not enabled. Value of 1: enabled. Indices defined by ENUM MAV_SYS_STATUS_SENSOR
Maximum usage in percent of the mainloop time, (0%: 0, 100%: 1000) should be always below 1000
Battery current, in 10*milliamperes (1 = 10 milliampere), -1: autopilot does not measure the current
Remaining battery energy: (0%: 0, 100%: 100), -1: autopilot estimate the remaining battery
Communication drops in percent, (0%: 0, 100%: 10'000), (UART, I2C, SPI, CAN), dropped packets on all links (packets that were corrupted on reception on the MAV)
Communication errors (UART, I2C, SPI, CAN), dropped packets on all links (packets that were corrupted on reception on the MAV)

message.name: SYSTEM_TIME
message.description: The system time is the time of the master clock, typically the computer clock of the main onboard computer.
message.field: Timestamp of the master clock in microseconds since UNIX epoch.
Timestamp of the component clock since boot time in milliseconds.

message.name: PING
message.description: A ping message either requesting or responding to a ping. This allows to measure the system latencies, including serial port, radio modem and UDP connections.
message.field: 0: request ping from all receiving systems, if greater than 0: message is a ping response and number is the system id of the requesting system
0: request ping from all receiving components, if greater than 0: message is a ping response and number is the system id of the requesting system

message.name: CHANGE_OPERATOR_CONTROL
message.description: Request to control this MAV
message.field: System the GCS requests control for
0: request control of this MAV, 1: Release control of this MAV

0: key as plaintext, 1-255: future, different hashing/encryption variants. The GCS should in general use the safest mode possible initially and then gradually move down the encryption level if it gets a NACK message indicating an encryption mismatch.
Password / Key, depending on version plaintext or encrypted. 25 or less characters, NULL terminated. The characters may involve A-Z, a-z, 0-9, and "!?,.-"

message.name: CHANGE_OPERATOR_CONTROL_ACK
message.description: Accept / deny control of this MAV
message.field: ID of the GCS this message
0: request control of this MAV, 1: Release control of this MAV
0: ACK, 1: NACK: Wrong passkey, 2: NACK: Unsupported passkey encryption method, 3: NACK: Already under control

message.name: AUTH_KEY
message.description: Emit an encrypted signature / key identifying this system. PLEASE NOTE: This protocol has been kept simple, so transmitting the key requires an encrypted channel for true safety.

message.name: SET_MODE
message.description: Set the system mode, as defined by enum MAV_MODE. There is no target component id as the mode is by definition for the overall aircraft, not only for one component.
message.field: The new autopilot-specific mode. This field can be ignored by an autopilot.

message.name: PARAM_REQUEST_READ
message.description: Request to read the onboard parameter with the param_id string id. Onboard parameters are stored as key[const char*] -> value[float]. This allows to send a parameter to any other component (such as the GCS) without the need of previous knowledge of possible parameter names. Thus the same GCS can store different parameters for different autopilots. See also http://qgroundcontrol.org/parameter_interface for a full documentation of QGroundControl and IMU code.
message.field: Onboard parameter id, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars - applications have to provide 16+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as string
Parameter index. Send -1 to use the param ID field as identifier (else the param id will be ignored)

message.name: PARAM_REQUEST_LIST
message.description: Request all parameters of this component. After his request, all parameters are emitted.

message.name: PARAM_VALUE
message.description: Emit the value of a onboard parameter. The inclusion of param_count and param_index in the message allows the recipient to keep track of received parameters and allows him to re-request missing parameters after a loss or timeout.
message.field: Onboard parameter id, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars - applications have to provide 16+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as string
Onboard parameter type: see the MAV_PARAM_TYPE enum for supported data types.

message.name: PARAM_SET
message.description: Set a parameter value TEMPORARILY to RAM. It will be reset to default on system reboot. Send the ACTION MAV_ACTION_STORAGE_WRITE to PERMANENTLY write the RAM contents to EEPROM. IMPORTANT: The receiving component should acknowledge the new parameter value by sending a param_value message to all communication partners. This will also ensure that multiple GCS all have an up-to-date list of all parameters. If the sending GCS did not receive a PARAM_VALUE message within its timeout time, it should re-send the PARAM_SET message.
message.field: Onboard parameter id, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars - applications have to provide 16+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as string
Onboard parameter type: see the MAV_PARAM_TYPE enum for supported data types.

message.name: GPS_RAW_INT
message.description: The global position, as returned by the Global Positioning System (GPS). This is NOT the global position estimate of the sytem, but rather a RAW sensor value. See message GLOBAL_POSITION for the global position estimate. Coordinate frame is right-handed, Z-axis up (GPS frame).
message.field: Timestamp (microseconds since UNIX epoch or microseconds since system boot)
0-1: no fix, 2: 2D fix, 3: 3D fix. Some applications will not use the value of this field unless it is at least two, so always correctly fill in the fix.
GPS HDOP horizontal dilution of position in cm (m*100). If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX
GPS VDOP vertical dilution of position in cm (m*100). If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX
GPS ground speed (m/s * 100). If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX
Course over ground (NOT heading, but direction of movement) in degrees * 100, 0.0..359.99 degrees. If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX
Number of satellites visible. If unknown, set to 255

message.name: GPS_STATUS
message.description: The positioning status, as reported by GPS. This message is intended to display status information about each satellite visible to the receiver. See message GLOBAL_POSITION for the global position estimate. This message can contain information for up to 20 satellites.
message.field: 0: Satellite not used, 1: used for localization
Elevation (0: right on top of receiver, 90: on the horizon) of satellite
Signal to noise ratio of satellite

message.name: SCALED_IMU
message.description: The RAW IMU readings for the usual 9DOF sensor setup. This message should contain the scaled values to the described units

message.name: RAW_IMU
message.description: The RAW IMU readings for the usual 9DOF sensor setup. This message should always contain the true raw values without any scaling to allow data capture and system debugging.
message.field: Timestamp (microseconds since UNIX epoch or microseconds since system boot)

message.name: RAW_PRESSURE
message.description: The RAW pressure readings for the typical setup of one absolute pressure and one differential pressure sensor. The sensor values should be the raw, UNSCALED ADC values.
message.field: Timestamp (microseconds since UNIX epoch or microseconds since system boot)

message.name: SCALED_PRESSURE
message.description: The pressure readings for the typical setup of one absolute and differential pressure sensor. The units are as specified in each field.

message.name: ATTITUDE
message.description: The attitude in the aeronautical frame (right-handed, Z-down, X-front, Y-right).

message.name: ATTITUDE_QUATERNION
message.description: The attitude in the aeronautical frame (right-handed, Z-down, X-front, Y-right), expressed as quaternion.

message.name: LOCAL_POSITION_NED
message.description: The filtered local position (e.g. fused computer vision and accelerometers). Coordinate frame is right-handed, Z-axis down (aeronautical frame, NED / north-east-down convention)

message.name: GLOBAL_POSITION_INT
message.description: The filtered global position (e.g. fused GPS and accelerometers). The position is in GPS-frame (right-handed, Z-up). It is designed as scaled integer message since the resolution of float is not sufficient.
message.field: Altitude in meters, expressed as * 1000 (millimeters), above MSL
Altitude above ground in meters, expressed as * 1000 (millimeters)
Ground X Speed (Latitude), expressed as m/s * 100
Ground Y Speed (Longitude), expressed as m/s * 100
Ground Z Speed (Altitude), expressed as m/s * 100
Compass heading in degrees * 100, 0.0..359.99 degrees. If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX

message.name: RC_CHANNELS_SCALED
message.description: The scaled values of the RC channels received. (-100%) -10000, (0%) 0, (100%) 10000. Channels that are inactive should be set to UINT16_MAX.
message.field: Servo output port (set of 8 outputs = 1 port). Most MAVs will just use one, but this allows for more than 8 servos.

message.name: RC_CHANNELS_RAW
message.description: The RAW values of the RC channels received. The standard PPM modulation is as follows: 1000 microseconds: 0%, 2000 microseconds: 100%. Individual receivers/transmitters might violate this specification.
message.field: Servo output port (set of 8 outputs = 1 port). Most MAVs will just use one, but this allows for more than 8 servos.
RC channel 1 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 2 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 3 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 4 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 5 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 6 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 7 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.
RC channel 8 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX implies the channel is unused.

message.name: SERVO_OUTPUT_RAW
message.description: The RAW values of the servo outputs (for RC input from the remote, use the RC_CHANNELS messages). The standard PPM modulation is as follows: 1000 microseconds: 0%, 2000 microseconds: 100%.
message.field: Servo output port (set of 8 outputs = 1 port). Most MAVs will just use one, but this allows to encode more than 8 servos.

message.name: MISSION_REQUEST_PARTIAL_LIST
message.description: Request a partial list of mission items from the system/component. http://qgroundcontrol.org/mavlink/waypoint_protocol. If start and end index are the same, just send one waypoint.
message.field: End index, -1 by default (-1: send list to end). Else a valid index of the list

message.name: MISSION_WRITE_PARTIAL_LIST
message.description: This message is sent to the MAV to write a partial list. If start index == end index, only one item will be transmitted / updated. If the start index is NOT 0 and above the current list size, this request should be REJECTED!
message.field: Start index, 0 by default and smaller / equal to the largest index of the current onboard list.
End index, equal or greater than start index.

message.name: MISSION_ITEM
message.description: Message encoding a mission item. This message is emitted to announce the presence of a mission item and to set a mission item on the system. The mission item can be either in x, y, z meters (type: LOCAL) or x:lat, y:lon, z:altitude. Local frame is Z-down, right handed (NED), global frame is Z-up, right handed (ENU). See also http://qgroundcontrol.org/mavlink/waypoint_protocol.
message.field: The coordinate system of the MISSION. see MAV_FRAME in mavlink_types.h
The scheduled action for the MISSION. see MAV_CMD in common.xml MAVLink specs
PARAM1 / For NAV command MISSIONs: Radius in which the MISSION is accepted as reached, in meters
PARAM2 / For NAV command MISSIONs: Time that the MAV should stay inside the PARAM1 radius before advancing, in milliseconds
PARAM3 / For LOITER command MISSIONs: Orbit to circle around the MISSION, in meters. If positive the orbit direction should be clockwise, if negative the orbit direction should be counter-clockwise.
PARAM4 / For NAV and LOITER command MISSIONs: Yaw orientation in degrees, [0..360] 0 = NORTH
PARAM5 / local: x position, global: latitude

message.name: MISSION_REQUEST
message.description: Request the information of the mission item with the sequence number seq. The response of the system to this message should be a MISSION_ITEM message. http://qgroundcontrol.org/mavlink/waypoint_protocol

message.name: MISSION_SET_CURRENT
message.description: Set the mission item with sequence number seq as current item. This means that the MAV will continue to this mission item on the shortest path (not following the mission items in-between).

message.name: MISSION_CURRENT
message.description: Message that announces the sequence number of the current active mission item. The MAV will fly towards this mission item.

message.name: MISSION_REQUEST_LIST
message.description: Request the overall list of mission items from the system/component.

message.name: MISSION_COUNT
message.description: This message is emitted as response to MISSION_REQUEST_LIST by the MAV and to initiate a write transaction. The GCS can then request the individual mission item based on the knowledge of the total number of MISSIONs.
message.field: Number of mission items in the sequence

message.name: MISSION_CLEAR_ALL
message.description: Delete all mission items at once.

message.name: MISSION_ITEM_REACHED
message.description: A certain mission item has been reached. The system will either hold this position (or circle on the orbit) or (if the autocontinue on the WP was set) continue to the next MISSION.

message.name: MISSION_ACK
message.description: Ack message during MISSION handling. The type field states if this message is a positive ack (type=0) or if an error happened (type=non-zero).

message.name: SET_GPS_GLOBAL_ORIGIN
message.description: As local waypoints exist, the global MISSION reference allows to transform between the local coordinate frame and the global (GPS) coordinate frame. This can be necessary when e.g. in- and outdoor settings are connected and the MAV should move from in- to outdoor.

message.name: GPS_GLOBAL_ORIGIN
message.description: Once the MAV sets a new GPS-Local correspondence, this message announces the origin (0,0,0) position

message.name: SET_LOCAL_POSITION_SETPOINT
message.description: Set the setpoint for a local position controller. This is the position in local coordinates the MAV should fly to. This message is sent by the path/MISSION planner to the onboard position controller. As some MAVs have a degree of freedom in yaw (e.g. all helicopters/quadrotors), the desired yaw angle is part of the message.
message.field: Coordinate frame - valid values are only MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_NED or MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_ENU

message.name: LOCAL_POSITION_SETPOINT
message.description: Transmit the current local setpoint of the controller to other MAVs (collision avoidance) and to the GCS.
message.field: Coordinate frame - valid values are only MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_NED or MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_ENU

message.name: GLOBAL_POSITION_SETPOINT_INT
message.description: Transmit the current local setpoint of the controller to other MAVs (collision avoidance) and to the GCS.
message.field: Coordinate frame - valid values are only MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL or MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL_RELATIVE_ALT

message.name: SET_GLOBAL_POSITION_SETPOINT_INT
message.description: Set the current global position setpoint.
message.field: Coordinate frame - valid values are only MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL or MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL_RELATIVE_ALT

message.name: SAFETY_SET_ALLOWED_AREA
message.description: Set a safety zone (volume), which is defined by two corners of a cube. This message can be used to tell the MAV which setpoints/MISSIONs to accept and which to reject. Safety areas are often enforced by national or competition regulations.
message.field: Coordinate frame, as defined by MAV_FRAME enum in mavlink_types.h. Can be either global, GPS, right-handed with Z axis up or local, right handed, Z axis down.

message.name: SAFETY_ALLOWED_AREA
message.description: Read out the safety zone the MAV currently assumes.
message.field: Coordinate frame, as defined by MAV_FRAME enum in mavlink_types.h. Can be either global, GPS, right-handed with Z axis up or local, right handed, Z axis down.

message.name: SET_ROLL_PITCH_YAW_THRUST
message.description: Set roll, pitch and yaw.

message.name: SET_ROLL_PITCH_YAW_SPEED_THRUST
message.description: Set roll, pitch and yaw.
message.field: Desired roll angular speed in rad/s
Desired pitch angular speed in rad/s
Desired yaw angular speed in rad/s

message.name: ROLL_PITCH_YAW_THRUST_SETPOINT
message.description: Setpoint in roll, pitch, yaw currently active on the system.
message.field: Timestamp in milliseconds since system boot

message.name: ROLL_PITCH_YAW_SPEED_THRUST_SETPOINT
message.description: Setpoint in rollspeed, pitchspeed, yawspeed currently active on the system.
message.field: Timestamp in milliseconds since system boot
Desired roll angular speed in rad/s
Desired pitch angular speed in rad/s
Desired yaw angular speed in rad/s

message.name: SET_QUAD_MOTORS_SETPOINT
message.description: Setpoint in the four motor speeds
message.field: System ID of the system that should set these motor commands
Front motor in + configuration, front left motor in x configuration
Right motor in + configuration, front right motor in x configuration
Back motor in + configuration, back right motor in x configuration
Left motor in + configuration, back left motor in x configuration

message.name: SET_QUAD_SWARM_ROLL_PITCH_YAW_THRUST
message.description: Setpoint for up to four quadrotors in a group / wing
message.field: ID of the quadrotor group (0 - 255, up to 256 groups supported)
ID of the flight mode (0 - 255, up to 256 modes supported)
Desired yaw angle in radians, scaled to int16 +-PI (+-INT16_MAX)

message.name: NAV_CONTROLLER_OUTPUT
message.description: Outputs of the APM navigation controller. The primary use of this message is to check the response and signs of the controller before actual flight and to assist with tuning controller parameters.
message.field: Bearing to current MISSION/target in degrees
Distance to active MISSION in meters
Current crosstrack error on x-y plane in meters

message.name: SET_QUAD_SWARM_LED_ROLL_PITCH_YAW_THRUST
message.description: Setpoint for up to four quadrotors in a group / wing
message.field: ID of the quadrotor group (0 - 255, up to 256 groups supported)
ID of the flight mode (0 - 255, up to 256 modes supported)
Desired yaw angle in radians, scaled to int16 +-PI (+-INT16_MAX)

message.name: STATE_CORRECTION
message.description: Corrects the systems state by adding an error correction term to the position and velocity, and by rotating the attitude by a correction angle.

message.name: REQUEST_DATA_STREAM
message.field: The target requested to send the message stream.
The target requested to send the message stream.
The ID of the requested data stream
The requested interval between two messages of this type
1 to start sending, 0 to stop sending.

message.name: DATA_STREAM
message.field: The ID of the requested data stream
The requested interval between two messages of this type
1 stream is enabled, 0 stream is stopped.

message.name: MANUAL_CONTROL
message.description: This message provides an API for manually controlling the vehicle using standard joystick axes nomenclature, along with a joystick-like input device. Unused axes can be disabled an buttons are also transmit as boolean values of their
message.field: X-axis, normalized to the range [-1000,1000]. A value of INT16_MAX indicates that this axis is invalid. Generally corresponds to forward(1000)-backward(-1000) movement on a joystick and the pitch of a vehicle.

Y-axis, normalized to the range [-1000,1000]. A value of INT16_MAX indicates that this axis is invalid. Generally corresponds to left(-1000)-right(1000) movement on a joystick and the roll of a vehicle.

Z-axis, normalized to the range [-1000,1000]. A value of INT16_MAX indicates that this axis is invalid. Generally corresponds to a separate slider movement with maximum being 1000 and minimum being -1000 on a joystick and the thrust of a vehicle.

R-axis, normalized to the range [-1000,1000]. A value of INT16_MAX indicates that this axis is invalid. Generally corresponds to a twisting of the joystick, with counter-clockwise being 1000 and clockwise being -1000, and the yaw of a vehicle.
A bitfield corresponding to the joystick buttons' current state, 1 for pressed, 0 for released. The lowest bit corresponds to Button 1.

message.name: RC_CHANNELS_OVERRIDE
message.description: The RAW values of the RC channels sent to the MAV to override info received from the RC radio. A value of UINT16_MAX means no change to that channel. A value of 0 means control of that channel should be released back to the RC radio. The standard PPM modulation is as follows: 1000 microseconds: 0%, 2000 microseconds: 100%. Individual receivers/transmitters might violate this specification.
message.field: RC channel 1 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field.
RC channel 2 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field.
RC channel 3 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field.
RC channel 4 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field.
RC channel 5 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field.
RC channel 6 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field.
RC channel 7 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field.
RC channel 8 value, in microseconds. A value of UINT16_MAX means to ignore this field.

message.name: VFR_HUD
message.description: Metrics typically displayed on a HUD for fixed wing aircraft
message.field: Current heading in degrees, in compass units (0..360, 0=north)
Current throttle setting in integer percent, 0 to 100

message.name: COMMAND_LONG
message.description: Send a command with up to seven parameters to the MAV
message.field: System which should execute the command
Component which should execute the command, 0 for all components
Command ID, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.
0: First transmission of this command. 1-255: Confirmation transmissions (e.g. for kill command)
Parameter 1, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.
Parameter 2, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.
Parameter 3, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.
Parameter 4, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.
Parameter 5, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.
Parameter 6, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.
Parameter 7, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.

message.name: COMMAND_ACK
message.description: Report status of a command. Includes feedback wether the command was executed.
message.field: Command ID, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.

message.name: ROLL_PITCH_YAW_RATES_THRUST_SETPOINT
message.description: Setpoint in roll, pitch, yaw rates and thrust currently active on the system.
message.field: Timestamp in milliseconds since system boot
Desired roll rate in radians per second
Desired pitch rate in radians per second
Desired yaw rate in radians per second

message.name: MANUAL_SETPOINT
message.description: Setpoint in roll, pitch, yaw and thrust from the operator
message.field: Timestamp in milliseconds since system boot
Desired roll rate in radians per second
Desired pitch rate in radians per second
Desired yaw rate in radians per second

message.name: LOCAL_POSITION_NED_SYSTEM_GLOBAL_OFFSET
message.description: The offset in X, Y, Z and yaw between the LOCAL_POSITION_NED messages of MAV X and the global coordinate frame in NED coordinates. Coordinate frame is right-handed, Z-axis down (aeronautical frame, NED / north-east-down convention)

message.name: HIL_STATE
message.description: DEPRECATED PACKET! Suffers from missing airspeed fields and singularities due to Euler angles. Please use HIL_STATE_QUATERNION instead. Sent from simulation to autopilot. This packet is useful for high throughput applications such as hardware in the loop simulations.
message.field: Timestamp (microseconds since UNIX epoch or microseconds since system boot)
Body frame roll / phi angular speed (rad/s)
Body frame pitch / theta angular speed (rad/s)
Body frame yaw / psi angular speed (rad/s)
Ground X Speed (Latitude), expressed as m/s * 100
Ground Y Speed (Longitude), expressed as m/s * 100
Ground Z Speed (Altitude), expressed as m/s * 100

message.name: HIL_CONTROLS
message.description: Sent from autopilot to simulation. Hardware in the loop control outputs
message.field: Timestamp (microseconds since UNIX epoch or microseconds since system boot)

message.name: HIL_RC_INPUTS_RAW
message.description: Sent from simulation to autopilot. The RAW values of the RC channels received. The standard PPM modulation is as follows: 1000 microseconds: 0%, 2000 microseconds: 100%. Individual receivers/transmitters might violate this specification.
message.field: Timestamp (microseconds since UNIX epoch or microseconds since system boot)

message.name: OPTICAL_FLOW
message.description: Optical flow from a flow sensor (e.g. optical mouse sensor)
message.field: Flow in pixels * 10 in x-sensor direction (dezi-pixels)
Flow in pixels * 10 in y-sensor direction (dezi-pixels)
Flow in meters in x-sensor direction, angular-speed compensated
Flow in meters in y-sensor direction, angular-speed compensated
Optical flow quality / confidence. 0: bad, 255: maximum quality
Ground distance in meters. Positive value: distance known. Negative value: Unknown distance

message.name: GLOBAL_VISION_POSITION_ESTIMATE
message.field: Timestamp (microseconds, synced to UNIX time or since system boot)

message.name: VISION_POSITION_ESTIMATE
message.field: Timestamp (microseconds, synced to UNIX time or since system boot)

message.name: VISION_SPEED_ESTIMATE
message.field: Timestamp (microseconds, synced to UNIX time or since system boot)

message.name: VICON_POSITION_ESTIMATE
message.field: Timestamp (microseconds, synced to UNIX time or since system boot)

message.name: HIGHRES_IMU
message.description: The IMU readings in SI units in NED body frame
message.field: Timestamp (microseconds, synced to UNIX time or since system boot)
Angular speed around X axis (rad / sec)
Angular speed around Y axis (rad / sec)
Angular speed around Z axis (rad / sec)
Bitmask for fields that have updated since last message, bit 0 = xacc, bit 12: temperature

message.name: OMNIDIRECTIONAL_FLOW
message.description: Optical flow from an omnidirectional flow sensor (e.g. PX4FLOW with wide angle lens)
message.field: Timestamp (microseconds, synced to UNIX time or since system boot)
Flow in deci pixels (1 = 0.1 pixel) on left hemisphere
Flow in deci pixels (1 = 0.1 pixel) on right hemisphere
Optical flow quality / confidence. 0: bad, 255: maximum quality
Front distance in meters. Positive value (including zero): distance known. Negative value: Unknown distance

message.name: HIL_SENSOR
message.description: The IMU readings in SI units in NED body frame
message.field: Timestamp (microseconds, synced to UNIX time or since system boot)
Angular speed around X axis in body frame (rad / sec)
Angular speed around Y axis in body frame (rad / sec)
Angular speed around Z axis in body frame (rad / sec)
Bitmask for fields that have updated since last message, bit 0 = xacc, bit 12: temperature

message.name: SIM_STATE
message.description: Status of simulation environment, if used
message.field: Attitude roll expressed as Euler angles, not recommended except for human-readable outputs
Attitude pitch expressed as Euler angles, not recommended except for human-readable outputs
Attitude yaw expressed as Euler angles, not recommended except for human-readable outputs
Angular speed around X axis rad/s
Angular speed around Y axis rad/s
Angular speed around Z axis rad/s
True velocity in m/s in NORTH direction in earth-fixed NED frame
True velocity in m/s in EAST direction in earth-fixed NED frame
True velocity in m/s in DOWN direction in earth-fixed NED frame

message.name: RADIO_STATUS
message.description: Status generated by radio
message.field: how full the tx buffer is as a percentage

message.name: FILE_TRANSFER_START
message.description: Begin file transfer
message.field: Transfer direction: 0: from requester, 1: to requester

message.name: FILE_TRANSFER_DIR_LIST
message.description: Get directory listing

message.name: FILE_TRANSFER_RES
message.description: File transfer result
message.field: 0: OK, 1: not permitted, 2: bad path / file name, 3: no space left on device

message.name: HIL_GPS
message.description: The global position, as returned by the Global Positioning System (GPS). This is NOT the global position estimate of the sytem, but rather a RAW sensor value. See message GLOBAL_POSITION for the global position estimate. Coordinate frame is right-handed, Z-axis up (GPS frame).
message.field: Timestamp (microseconds since UNIX epoch or microseconds since system boot)
0-1: no fix, 2: 2D fix, 3: 3D fix. Some applications will not use the value of this field unless it is at least two, so always correctly fill in the fix.
GPS HDOP horizontal dilution of position in cm (m*100). If unknown, set to: 65535
GPS VDOP vertical dilution of position in cm (m*100). If unknown, set to: 65535
GPS ground speed (m/s * 100). If unknown, set to: 65535
GPS velocity in cm/s in NORTH direction in earth-fixed NED frame
GPS velocity in cm/s in EAST direction in earth-fixed NED frame
GPS velocity in cm/s in DOWN direction in earth-fixed NED frame
Course over ground (NOT heading, but direction of movement) in degrees * 100, 0.0..359.99 degrees. If unknown, set to: 65535
Number of satellites visible. If unknown, set to 255

message.name: HIL_OPTICAL_FLOW
message.description: Simulated optical flow from a flow sensor (e.g. optical mouse sensor)
message.field: Flow in pixels in x-sensor direction
Flow in pixels in y-sensor direction
Flow in meters in x-sensor direction, angular-speed compensated
Flow in meters in y-sensor direction, angular-speed compensated
Optical flow quality / confidence. 0: bad, 255: maximum quality
Ground distance in meters. Positive value: distance known. Negative value: Unknown distance

message.name: HIL_STATE_QUATERNION
message.description: Sent from simulation to autopilot, avoids in contrast to HIL_STATE singularities. This packet is useful for high throughput applications such as hardware in the loop simulations.
message.field: Timestamp (microseconds since UNIX epoch or microseconds since system boot)
Vehicle attitude expressed as normalized quaternion
Body frame roll / phi angular speed (rad/s)
Body frame pitch / theta angular speed (rad/s)
Body frame yaw / psi angular speed (rad/s)
Ground X Speed (Latitude), expressed as m/s * 100
Ground Y Speed (Longitude), expressed as m/s * 100
Ground Z Speed (Altitude), expressed as m/s * 100

message.name: SCALED_IMU2
message.description: The RAW IMU readings for secondary 9DOF sensor setup. This message should contain the scaled values to the described units

message.name: BATTERY_STATUS
message.description: Transmitte battery informations for a accu pack.
message.field: Battery voltage of cell 1, in millivolts (1 = 1 millivolt)
Battery voltage of cell 2, in millivolts (1 = 1 millivolt), -1: no cell
Battery voltage of cell 3, in millivolts (1 = 1 millivolt), -1: no cell
Battery voltage of cell 4, in millivolts (1 = 1 millivolt), -1: no cell
Battery voltage of cell 5, in millivolts (1 = 1 millivolt), -1: no cell
Battery voltage of cell 6, in millivolts (1 = 1 millivolt), -1: no cell
Battery current, in 10*milliamperes (1 = 10 milliampere), -1: autopilot does not measure the current
Consumed charge, in milliampere hours (1 = 1 mAh), -1: autopilot does not provide mAh consumption estimate
Consumed energy, in 100*Joules (intergrated U*I*dt) (1 = 100 Joule), -1: autopilot does not provide energy consumption estimate
Remaining battery energy: (0%: 0, 100%: 100), -1: autopilot does not estimate the remaining battery

message.name: SETPOINT_8DOF
message.description: Set the 8 DOF setpoint for a controller.

message.name: SETPOINT_6DOF
message.description: Set the 6 DOF setpoint for a attitude and position controller.

message.name: MEMORY_VECT
message.description: Send raw controller memory. The use of this message is discouraged for normal packets, but a quite efficient way for testing new messages and getting experimental debug output.
message.field: Starting address of the debug variables
Version code of the type variable. 0=unknown, type ignored and assumed int16_t. 1=as below
Type code of the memory variables. for ver = 1: 0=16 x int16_t, 1=16 x uint16_t, 2=16 x Q15, 3=16 x 1Q14

message.name: NAMED_VALUE_FLOAT
message.description: Send a key-value pair as float. The use of this message is discouraged for normal packets, but a quite efficient way for testing new messages and getting experimental debug output.

message.name: NAMED_VALUE_INT
message.description: Send a key-value pair as integer. The use of this message is discouraged for normal packets, but a quite efficient way for testing new messages and getting experimental debug output.

message.name: STATUSTEXT
message.description: Status text message. These messages are printed in yellow in the COMM console of QGroundControl. WARNING: They consume quite some bandwidth, so use only for important status and error messages. If implemented wisely, these messages are buffered on the MCU and sent only at a limited rate (e.g. 10 Hz).
message.field: Severity of status. Relies on the definitions within RFC-5424. See enum MAV_SEVERITY.
Status text message, without null termination character

message.name: DEBUG
message.description: Send a debug value. The index is used to discriminate between values. These values show up in the plot of QGroundControl as DEBUG N.
